page.title: 12LITTLE WITLEY AGRICULTURE-1
page.content: The{land used}for agriculture is nearly all owner occupied with a parcel of 200 acres of permanent grassland rented out on a ten month tenancy. The agriculture of the area is divided equally between{arable, {grassland and woodland. The{arable}comprises cereals (wheat and barley) of which 60% is winter sown varieties, since the soil is on the heavy side. Most of the straw is sold in the field to surrounding stock farmers, with a small proportion burnt. A high proportion of{cash crops}are grown - potatoes and sugar beet, rape and lupins for oil and a small quantity of pulse crops (forage peas and field beans). The bi-products and surplus (sugar beet tops and stock feed potatoes) are utilized by store lambs bought in and fattened off.
